update.description:
Update to SDF 1.6. This is because the `<imu> <noise>` needs to change. 

* All the `.sdf` files are the same as in 1.5, except for `imu.sdf`.
* A `1_5.convert` script was added
* The `Converter` was updated to handle the complex imu conversion required.
* A test for the IMU conversion was added.
update.title: sdf 1.6

content.raw: Thanks, reverted in 8920091
content.html: Thanks, reverted in 8920091

update.description:

update.title: sdf 1.6

content.raw: The `gui.sdf` file differs between 1.5 and 1.6, there's a `follow_model` tag.
content.html: The gui.sdf file differs between 1.5 and 1.6, there's a follow_model tag.

content.raw: sounds good
content.html: sounds good

content.raw: I checked outstanding issues in the sdformat issue tracker. It looks like a few additions are requested, but nothing that would require a protocol version bump.
content.html: I checked outstanding issues in the sdformat issue tracker. It looks like a few additions are requested, but nothing that would require a protocol version bump.

content.raw:
Are we going to add anything else to sdf 1.6? It looks like this will be [required by gazebo7](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1992/gazebo7-deprecations-part3/diff#chg-cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake). Some [geometry enhancements](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/427/sdf-geometry-enhancements) would be nice.

I bring this up because there is some cost to bumping the SDF protocol version, so it would be nice to get our money's worth.
content.html:
Are we going to add anything else to sdf 1.6? It looks like this will be required by gazebo7. Some geometry enhancements would be nice.

I bring this up because there is some cost to bumping the SDF protocol version, so it would be nice to get our money's worth.

content.raw: [drone is happy](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/1060)
content.html: drone is happy

content.raw: Fixed: 086f2d3
content.html: Fixed: 086f2d3

Update to SDF 1.6. This is because the `<imu> <noise>` needs to change.

content.raw: Solution is to add the previous sdf protocol versions to the `SDF_PATH` env variable. Implementing now.
content.html: Solution is to add the previous sdf protocol versions to the SDF_PATH env variable. Implementing now.

content.raw: I'm wrong about that.
content.html: I'm wrong about that.

content.raw: I believe the `SDF_PATH` environment variable is not set. The `SDFUtils.cmake` file has a few lines that are suppose to set this env var, but it is not working.
content.html: I believe the SDF_PATH environment variable is not set. The SDFUtils.cmake file has a few lines that are suppose to set this env var, but it is not working.

content.raw:
* [Windows compiles fine](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/6)
* [OsX is ok](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/3/)
* [Trusty is ok](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/13/)

A part from the failing test, the whole thing plays nicely with gazebo7 using the PR2 world.
content.html:
• Windows compiles fine
  • OsX is ok
  • Trusty is ok

A part from the failing test, the whole thing plays nicely with gazebo7 using the PR2 world.

content.raw:
I've [run this same PR in jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/11/), running first the tests and installing after it. It did not fail. Or I'm doing wrong or the problem is elsewhere.

**update:**  I've seen the test failing and passing in my box in different runs. Race condition?
content.html:
I've run this same PR in jenkins, running first the tests and installing after it. It did not fail. Or I'm doing wrong or the problem is elsewhere.

update: I've seen the test failing and passing in my box in different runs. Race condition?

content.raw: Ok. I'll look into it.
content.html: Ok. I'll look into it.

content.raw:
this test [passed with jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/sdformat/job/sdformat-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/117/) though

I think the difference is that drone calls `make test` before `sudo make install`. I've confirmed on my mac laptop that `INTEGRATION_joint_axis_frame` fails without `sudo make install` but passes with an install.
content.html:
this test passed with jenkins though

I think the difference is that drone calls make test before sudo make install. I've confirmed on my mac laptop that INTEGRATION_joint_axis_frame fails without sudo make install but passes with an install.

content.raw:
`INTEGRATION_joint_axis_frame` test is failing:

* https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/1056

~~~
17: [ RUN      ] JointAxisFrame.Version_1_4_missing
17: Error [Converter.cc:127] Unable to convert from SDF version 1.4 to 1.6
17: <axis>
17:   <xyz>1 0 0</xyz>
17:   <use_parent_model_frame>0</use_parent_model_frame>
17:   <limit>
17:     <lower>-1e+16</lower>
17:     <upper>1e+16</upper>
17:   </limit>
17: </axis>
17: /home/ubuntu/src/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/test/integration/joint_axis_frame.cc:59: Failure
17: Value of: axis->Get<bool>("use_parent_model_frame")
17:   Actual: false
17: Expected: true
17: [  FAILED  ] JointAxisFrame.Version_1_4_missing (107 ms)

~~~
content.html:
INTEGRATION_joint_axis_frame test is failing:

  • https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/1056
17: [ RUN      ] JointAxisFrame.Version_1_4_missing
17: Error [Converter.cc:127] Unable to convert from SDF version 1.4 to 1.6
17: <axis>
17:   <xyz>1 0 0</xyz>
17:   <use_parent_model_frame>0</use_parent_model_frame>
17:   <limit>
17:     <lower>-1e+16</lower>
17:     <upper>1e+16</upper>
17:   </limit>
17: </axis>
17: /home/ubuntu/src/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/test/integration/joint_axis_frame.cc:59: Failure
17: Value of: axis->Get<bool>("use_parent_model_frame")
17:   Actual: false
17: Expected: true
17: [  FAILED  ] JointAxisFrame.Version_1_4_missing (107 ms)

* All the `.sdf` files are the same as in 1.5, except for `imu.sdf`.
* A `1_5.convert` script was added
* The `Converter` was updated to handle the complex imu conversion required.
* A test for the IMU conversion was added.
